paper.title: Hoodsquare: Modeling and Recommending Neighborhoods in Location-based Social Networks
paper.abstract: Information garnered from activity on location-based social networks can be harnessed to characterize urban spaces and organize them into neighborhoods. We adopt a data-driven approach to the identification and modeling of urban neighborhoods using location-based social networks.

paper.title: On the Study of Diurnal Urban Routines on Twitter
paper.abstract: We study and characterize diurnal patterns in social media data for different urban areas, with the goal of providing context and framing for reasoning about such patterns at different scales. Using one of the largest datasets to date of Twitter content associated with different locations, we examine within-day variability and across-day variability of diurnal keyword patterns for different locations.
